column2:
<!-- rnb-source-begin  -->

```r
# severity probability masses
y <- c(0, 0.25, 0.375, 0.375)
# S ~ CompPois(0.8, g), g is above

# S = 1* N1 + 2*N2 + 3*N3
# finding prob vectors of each term
X <- dpois(0:10, 0.25*0.8)

# populating every even index with mass
Y <- rep(0,11)
Y[c(1,3,5,7,9,11)] <- dpois(0:5, 0.375*0.8)

# populating with mass every multiple of 3
Z <- rep(0,11)
Z[c(1,4,7,10)] <- dpois(0:3, 0.375*0.8)

# convolving normally

#S1 = 0,1,...,20
X <- c(X, rep(0,10))
Y <- c(Y, rep(0,10))

S1 <- sapply(1:21,
             function(i){
               sum(X[1:i] * Y[i:1])
             })



# S2 = S1 + Z = 0,..., 30
S1 <- c(S1, rep(0,10))
Z <- c(Z, rep(0,20))

S2 <- sapply(1:31,
             function(i){
               sum(S1[1:i] * Z[i:1])
             })

S2[1:6]
```

<!-- rnb-source-end -->

```r
# severity probability masses
y <- c(0, 0.25, 0.375, 0.375)
# S ~ CompPois(0.8, g), g is above

# S = 1* N1 + 2*N2 + 3*N3
# finding prob vectors of each term
X <- dpois(0:10, 0.25*0.8)

# populating every even index with mass
Y <- rep(0,11)
Y[c(1,3,5,7,9,11)] <- dpois(0:5, 0.375*0.8)

# populating with mass every multiple of 3
Z <- rep(0,11)
Z[c(1,4,7,10)] <- dpois(0:3, 0.375*0.8)

# convolving normally

#S1 = 0,1,...,20
X <- c(X, rep(0,10))
Y <- c(Y, rep(0,10))

S1 <- sapply(1:21,
             function(i){
               sum(X[1:i] * Y[i:1])
             })



# S2 = S1 + Z = 0,..., 30
S1 <- c(S1, rep(0,10))
Z <- c(Z, rep(0,20))

S2 <- sapply(1:31,
             function(i){
               sum(S1[1:i] * Z[i:1])
             })
```
